title: How to Make Gluten Free Brownies

steps.headline: Oil a 13x9 pan.
steps.description: (Do not use Crisco, or the ingredients will stick to the pan.) Set the pan aside.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate and butter together in saucepan or microwave.
steps.description: Let it cool off for a while.

steps.headline: Beat the eggs and salt in a bowl with a fork whilst cooling or whisk until light and fluffy.
Add sugar and vanilla gradually.
steps.description: Beat it well with a fork.

steps.headline: Add chocolate/butter mixture, flour, baking powder, and cornstarch gradually, and mix well with a fork.
steps.description: Soy flour has a pretty distinctive flavor that some may not like. Experiment with other gluten-free flours; like tapioca or rice flour.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the pan.
steps.description: Mixture will be thick. Spread in oiled pan.

steps.headline: Top with more nut halves, if desired.
Bake at 350ºF (180ºC) for 25 minutes, or until it passes the toothpick test.
Melt your shortening in medium sized saucepan over medium heat.
Turn heat down to low, and stir in your cocoa, and white sugar.
Take pan off the heat.
steps.description: Add the rest of your ingredients and mix well.

steps.headline: Bake in a 350-375 degree oven for 15-20 minutes.
Finished.
steps.description: These brownies break easily, so after they are baked, let them cool for an hour or so before cutting.

text: First Variation Oil a 13x9 pan. (Do not use Crisco, or the ingredients will stick to the pan.) Set the pan aside. Melt the chocolate and butter together in saucepan or microwave. Let it cool off for a while. Beat the eggs and salt in a bowl with a fork whilst cooling or whisk until light and fluffy.  Add sugar and vanilla gradually. Beat it well with a fork. Add chocolate/butter mixture, flour, baking powder, and cornstarch gradually, and mix well with a fork. Soy flour has a pretty distinctive flavor that some may not like. Experiment with other gluten-free flours; like tapioca or rice flour. Add nuts/chips as desired.  Pour the mixture into the pan. Mixture will be thick. Spread in oiled pan. Top with more nut halves, if desired.  Bake at 350ºF (180ºC) for 25 minutes, or until it passes the toothpick test.  Cut when cool.  Finished.  Second Variation Melt your shortening in medium sized saucepan over medium heat.  Turn heat down to low, and stir in your cocoa, and white sugar.  Take pan off the heat. Add the rest of your ingredients and mix well. Bake in a 350-375 degree oven for 15-20 minutes. Yummy! Finished. These brownies break easily, so after they are baked, let them cool for an hour or so before cutting.
